intro: Verbascum dechyanum, commonly known as the Armenian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. Its leaves are large and velvety, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Verbascum dechyanum is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
